text: Ali Rehman Khan (Pashto /; born 6 May 1986) is a Pakistani film, television and theater actor. He is best known for his work in the Hum TV drama Rishtay Kuch Adhooray Se, which earned him a Hum Award for Best Television Sensation Male at the 2nd Hum Awards. He made his film debut in the 2011 controversial film Slackistan. ==Early life and education == Ali Rehman Khan was born in Islamabad to a Pashtun father, from the Marwat tribe that originated from Lakki Marwat. His mother is half Pashtun, half Irish. He attended University College of Islamabad where he pursued International Programmes and went on to receive his postgraduate degree from University of London. ==Career== Rehman made his debut in the Hum TV drama serial Rishtay Kuch Adhooray Se. He then starred in the 2014 drama serial Muhabbat Ab Nahi Hugi. His third drama serial Diyar-e-Dil which premiered in March 2015 along with Hareem Farooq, Meekal Zulfiqar and Sanam Saeed. Khan's film credits include Slackistan and the comedy-drama Gol Chakkar. Both films are still unreleased; Slackistan was banned by Central Board of Film Censors (CBFC), Pakistan due to strong language and dialogue. Gol Chakkar was approved and was screened in October 2012. He was cast in the romantic-comedy film Janaan with fellow television actors Bilal Ashraf and Armeena Khan. The film was released on 13 September 2016. == Filmography == {| class="wikitable" |+Key | |denotes film / drama that has not released yet |- | | Denotes films / drama that are currently on cinema / on air |} ===Film=== {| class="wikitable" |- !
